radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple dural-based enhancing lesions of the skull base including lesions at the planum sphenoidale and tuberculum sella compressing the optic nerves, bilateral lesions from the cerebellopontine angle to the foramen magnum compressing the brainstem, and a lesion at C-2.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial postoperative MR images showed decompression of both optic nerves and residual disease. Follow-up MR images at 6 weeks showed marked resolution of the multiple skull base lesions. At 10 months postoperative follow-up, repeated MR imaging showed interval progression of enhancing lesions, especially in the posterior fossa. A follow-up MR image obtained 1 month later indicated resolution of the enhancing lesions again.
